result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonard J. Parise

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonard J. Parise in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Leonard J. Parise.  Prosecuting attorney Rosa Delgado in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
at the request of Attorney Schum, STC on 11/8/2022 has been rescheduled to a PH on 11/1/2022 at 930am Intake. DA notified.
Motion to Vacate Initial Appearance and Schedule Preliminary Hearing

1:39 PM
Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in custody. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm. atty status. Bond continued as previously set. SPD has not appointed counsel for DE. DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. ec

Defendant Leonard J. Parise in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE was going to retain private but has not yet.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:Dana M., Restaurant 1300 Sheridan Road.   The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim D.M's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.
